title: Congress rakes up Jagdeep Dhankhar’s remarks to raise farmers’ protest issue in Rajya Sabha
desc: Opposition members in the Rajya Sabha protested against the government's handling of farmer demands, citing Chairman Dhankhar's recent remarks on the issue. They shouted slogans, staged a walkout, and demanded action on Minimum Support Price (MSP) guarantees. Dhankhar criticized the Opposition's timing, claiming their concern was disingenuous. The House eventually resumed normal function.

title: When the farmers go marching in, again
desc: Farmers from Punjab are marching to Delhi to demand a legal guarantee for Minimum Support Price (MSP). While full MSP is fiscally challenging, a blend of price and income support is viable. Price supports can distort markets, while income supports can impact production.

title: Opposition shuns disruption; debates
desc: Rajya Sabha resumed normal functioning as the Opposition dropped plans to disrupt proceedings. Key issues such as law and order in various states, the Adani bribery issue, and displacement due to natural calamities were debated. A bill was passed and multiple pressing topics were discussed during the zero hour and question hour.

title: More than 160 protesting farmers arrested in Noida; unions urge judiciary to intervene, threaten to widen stir
desc: Police arrested over 160 protesting farmers, including key leaders, in Noida after their march to Delhi was blocked. The farmers, seeking land compensation, were detained around 1.30 pm. They had protested near Dalit Prerna Sthal, causing traffic disruptions. The Bharatiya Kisan Union condemned the arrests and called a panchayat in Muzaffarnagar.

title: Massive jams at Delhi-Noida border as police set up barricades to stop farmers' march
desc: Massive traffic snarls inconvenienced commuters crossing the Delhi-Noida border as farmers marched towards the national capital. Police set up barricades and deployed heavy security due to the protest. Commuters faced heavy traffic on major routes, and some opted for the metro. Drones were used for surveillance, and adequate measures were taken to manage the situation.

title: Traffic chaos on Noida-Greater Noida Expressway due to farmers' protest
desc: Farmers' protest march to Delhi has caused major traffic jams on the Noida-Greater Noida expressway. Police have set up barricades and are conducting checks to prevent the farmers from reaching Delhi. The diversion of traffic has led to congestion on internal roads, and the protest is ongoing due to unresolved land disputes.

title: What is Centre's mission to create 'Farmer ID' similar to Aadhaar card? Here's all about plan to digitise agriculture
desc: India's Union Cabinet approved the 'Digital Agriculture Mission' with a budget of Rs. 2,817 Crore. The mission aims to create digital identities for farmers and various digital agriculture initiatives. The scheme includes Digital Public Infrastructure, the Digital General Crop Estimation Survey, and other IT initiatives. Key targets include creating digital identities for 11 crore farmers in the next three years.

title: Fearing loss of land, farmers oppose proposed Anantnag-Pahalgam railway line
desc: Farmers in Anantnag district are urging the Jammu and Kashmir government to abandon plans for a railway line to Pahalgam, citing potential damage to fertile lands and livelihoods. Local leaders echo their concerns, stressing the impact on the agrarian economy and the need for broader stakeholder engagement before proceeding.

title: Bhartiya Kisan Parishad to start its farmer's march to Delhi on Monday
desc: Sukhbir Khalifa of the Bhartiya Kisan Parishad announced plans for a farmer march towards Delhi on December 2 to demand compensation and benefits under new agricultural laws. Other farmer groups, such as the Kisan Mazdoor Morcha and Samyukt Kisan Morcha, are also organizing marches, pressing for demands like a guaranteed Minimum Support Price (MSP).

title: 'My doors are open for farmers 24/7': VP Dhankhar urges protesting farmers to resolve issues through dialogue
desc: Terming an irretrievable and confrontational stance as poor diplomacy, he emphasized, "We need to think openly and engage in open discussions because this country belongs to us. It is deeply influenced by its rural roots, and I believe that wherever my farmer brothers are and whichever protest they may be part of, my words will reach them, and they will pay attention. I am confident that a convergence of positive energy will lead to the swiftest resolution of farmers' issues."

title: Farmers' Protest in Delhi: Why are farmers marching to the national capital again? What're their planned routes and demands?
desc: Farmers' Protest in Delhi: Farmers' organisations will start protests on December 2, marching towards Delhi for fair compensation and better benefits under new agricultural laws. Similar protests by other farmer groups will begin on December 6. Farmers are demanding a legally guaranteed Minimum Support Price, farm loan waiver, pension for farmers, no hike in electricity tariffs, and withdrawal of police cases.

title: Engage in peaceful protests, don't cause inconvenience to people: Supreme Court tells protesting farmers
desc: The Supreme Court addressed the protest by Punjab farmer leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal, advising that protests should not obstruct highways or cause public inconvenience. Farmers are demanding a legal guarantee for Minimum Support Price, implementation of the Swaminathan Commission's recommendations, and other grievances. The court emphasized the importance of peaceful and lawful protests.

title: Farmers' Protest: Police release traffic advisory for Noida-Delhi march: Full list of routes to avoid
desc: The Noida Police, in collaboration with Delhi Police, has issued an extensive traffic advisory ahead of the farmers' planned march to Delhi. Restrictions on heavy vehicles, alternative routes, and Metro recommendations have been outlined to minimise disruptions. Farmers under the Samyukta Kisan Morcha and allied groups are demanding compensation and a legal guarantee on MSP. Police have set up barricades and initiated intensive border checks. Protestors have been camping at borders since February, escalating their demands.

title: Post-independence narratives manipulated to credit only select individuals: Dhankhar
desc: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar criticized the manipulation of India's post-independence history books. He said it overlooked the contributions of some heroes of the freedom struggle. He called for presenting unvarnished historical accounts. He also emphasized the need for dialogue to resolve farmers' issues. Dhankhar stated that an irretrievable confrontational stance is poor diplomacy.

title: Punjab: Farmer leader Dallewal sits on fast-unto-death at Khanauri border
desc: Punjab farmer leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal begins a fast-unto-death at the Khanauri border after being discharged from a hospital. Initially, Sukhjit Singh Hardojhande was on hunger strike but ended it as planned among the farmer leaders. Farmers demand the Centre address their concerns, including a legal guarantee for MSP and other long-standing issues.

title: Punjab: Farmers from Shambhu to march towards Delhi on December 6
desc: Farmers protesting at the Shambhu border plan to march to Delhi on December 6th to demand guaranteed minimum support prices for their crops. They criticize the BJP for using divisive tactics during elections and urge Prime Minister Modi to address the violence in Manipur. The farmers have been protesting for 284 days and have blocked several highways in Punjab.

title: Samunnati ties up with Northern Farmers Mega FPO to boost sustainable agriculture
desc: Samunnati has partnered with Northern Farmers Mega FPO to empower over 50 Farmer Producer Organizations in northern India. The collaboration will focus on sustainable farming practices, market access, and converting paddy straw waste into clean energy, addressing pollution concerns and boosting agricultural prosperity.

title: Rahul forced Centre to hear everyone in Parliament, says Surjewala; bats for soybean farmers
desc: Congress leader Randeep Singh Surjewala accused the BJP of stifling parliamentary discussions and stated that Rahul Gandhi had compelled the government to engage with all parties. Surjewala also criticized the government's handling of soybean procurement in Maharashtra, claiming that farmers were facing significant losses due to low Minimum Support Prices.

title: Budget delay 'exposes' CM Naidu's 'super six' failures: Jagan Mohan Reddy
desc: YS Jagan Mohan Reddy, YSRCP Chief, has accused Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu of delaying the budget presentation to avoid scrutiny of unfulfilled poll promises. Reddy claims the eight-month delay, relying on vote-on-account budgets, was a tactic to hide the government's failure to deliver on the 'Super Six' schemes promised in the TDP's 2024 manifesto.

title: BJP doing politics: Karnataka minister Priyank Kharge on Waqf Board row
desc: Karnataka Minister Priyank Kharge accused the BJP of playing politics over the Waqf Board land claims issue. The claims, affecting farmers, temples, and historical sites, have sparked controversy. The government has ordered a halt to land mutation processes and the withdrawal of eviction notices.

title: With bypolls staring Congress in face, Govt orders withdrawal of Waqf notices issued to farmers
desc: The Karnataka government has ordered the immediate withdrawal of all notices issued to farmers and citizens asserting the Waqf Board's ownership of their land. This move comes amidst bypolls and strong opposition from the BJP and JDS, who have made it a major campaign issue.

title: BJP MP Tejasvi Surya, editors of Kannada news portals booked for allegedly spreading fake news
desc: BJP MP Tejasvi Surya and Kannada news portals face legal action for allegedly spreading misinformation about a farmer's suicide. Surya linked the death to land disputes with the Waqf Board, a claim refuted by police who cited loan and crop loss as the cause. Surya later deleted his social media post based on the news reports.

title: Waqf row: JPC chairman meets farmers in Karnataka, Congress lashes out
desc: Jagdambika Pal, Chairman of the Joint Parliamentary Committee (JPC) on the Waqf Amendment Bill, visited Karnataka to address farmers' claims that the Waqf board is laying claim to their land. Farmers allege that despite possessing land for generations, the Waqf board is asserting ownership. Pal aims to investigate these claims and submit a comprehensive report.

title: Waqf properties row: JPC Chairman receives over 500 petitions from aggrieved farmers in Karnataka
desc: Farmers in Karnataka's northern districts submitted over 500 petitions to Jagdambika Pal, Chairman of the Joint Committee of Parliament on the Waqf (Amendment) Bill, alleging their lands were wrongly classified as Waqf properties. Pal, joined by BJP MP Tejasvi Surya, assured the farmers their concerns would be addressed. Deputy Chief Minister D.K. Shivakumar criticized the visit as politically motivated.

title: Waqf row: JPC Chairman in Karnataka on "fact finding", to meet aggrieved persons
desc: Jagdambika Pal, Chairman of the Joint Committee of Parliament on the Waqf (Amendment) Bill, is visiting Karnataka to address farmers' concerns over land claims by the State Waqf Board. Accompanied by MP Tejasvi Surya, Pal aims to gather facts and meet aggrieved farmers alleging misclassification of their lands as Waqf properties, prompting protests and government intervention.

title: JPC chairman Jagdambika Pal to visit K'taka on Nov 7 to meet farmers protesting Waqf notices
desc: Jagdambika Pal, Chairman of the Joint Committee of Parliament on the Waqf (Amendment) Bill, will be visiting Karnataka. He will meet with farmers who were served notices over alleged encroachment on Waqf properties. The notices have since been withdrawn. Pal will also meet with Karnataka BJP leaders. The BJP has raised concerns over the issue.

title: Karnataka CM trying to distract farmers during by-elections: BJP's Bommai on retraction of notices related to Waqf land
desc: Former Karnataka Chief Minister Basavraj Bommai criticizes state government's retraction of waqf land notices, calling it a diversion during by-elections. BJP's Shehzad Poonawalla and LoP Chalavadi Narayanaswamy also term the move as an attempt to win votes, urging the withdrawal of the 1974 gazette.

title: Congress government ended 'darkness' in 11 months of rule in Telangana: CM Revanth Reddy rebuts PM Modi's remark
desc: The Congress government in Telangana has transformed the state in the last 11 months. Key initiatives include free bus travel for women, a healthcare cover of Rs 10 lakhs, a massive farmer loan waiver, free electricity for women, and significant job recruitment. The government is also rejuvenating water bodies and ensuring overall development.

title: My statement was twisted, says DK Shivkumar after Kharge pulls up Karnataka govt
desc: DK Shivakumar retracted his remarks about possibly reviewing Karnataka's 'Shakti' scheme, which offers free bus travel to women, following criticism from Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge. Shivakumar claimed his statement was twisted and emphasized his respect for elders' decisions. The 'Shakti' scheme is part of the Congress government's initiatives in Karnataka.
